com.addicticks.net.httpsupload

Interface FileUploadProgress


  • public interface FileUploadProgress
    Gives information about file upload progress. See HttpsFileUploader.

    Note that it is perfectly possible to receive the callbacks in this class even if the upload is failing. Therefore it is important that the result of the upload operation, HttpsFileUploaderResult, is always checked.

    Author:
    Addicticks

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void uploadEnd(long totalSizeAll, long msecondsUsed)
      Informs that the upload operation has completed.
      void uploadProgress(File file, long totalSize, int pct)

    • Method Detail

      • uploadStart

        void uploadStart(int noOfFiles,
                 long totalSizeAll)
        Informs that an upload operation is about to begin. An upload operation may include multiple files (noOfFiles > 1.
        Parameters:
        noOfFiles - the number of files that will be uploaded in this upload operation.
        totalSizeAll - the total number of file bytes that will be sent in this upload operation (the sum of the size of all files in the upload operation)

      • uploadProgress

        void uploadProgress(File file,
                    long totalSize,
                    int pct)
        Informs about file upload progress for a given file.

        The same percentage will never be reported twice. For each file being uploaded there will be between 2 (one for "0%" and one for "100%") and maximum 101 invocations of this method. There will always be a "0%" and a "100%" invocation. The "0%" invocation can effectively be interpreted as a file is about to be uploaded while the "100%" invocation can be interpreted as the the upload for that file has been completed.

        Regarding multi-file uploads: Files are uploaded sequentially and in the order they are specified in the uploadFiles map. This callback is about a single of each such file upload. Therefore the values in totalSize and pct relate only to this single file upload and not the whole upload operation.

        For very small files (below 8K) there will only be a "0%" and a "100%" invocation as such file is uploaded in a single write operation.

        Parameters:
        file - local file currently being uploaded
        totalSize - total number of bytes to be sent in the upload (size in bytes of the current file being uploaded)
        pct - upload progress in percentage. Value between 0 and 100.

      • uploadEnd

        void uploadEnd(long totalSizeAll,
               long msecondsUsed)
        Informs that the upload operation has completed.
        Parameters:
        totalSizeAll - the total number of file bytes that was sent in this upload operation (the sum of the size of all files in the upload operation)
        msecondsUsed - number of milliseconds used on the file upload operation
